contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Espoo | Name = Nuuksio | Name-sv = Noux | Map = Espoo districts Nuuksio.png | Main district = Vanha-Espoo | Inner district = Nuuksionpää | Population = 123 | Population year = 2006 | Finnish = 82.1 | Swedish = 17.1 | Other = 0.8 | Jobs = 54 }} '''Nuuksio''' ([[Finnish language|Finnish]]) or '''Noux''' ([[Swedish language|Swedish]]) is a [[Districts of Espoo|district]] of [[Espoo]], a city in [[Finland]], best known for the [[Nuuksio National Park]]. The [[Solvalla Sports Institute]] is also located in Nuuksio. == Etymology == The Finnish name, ''Nuuksio'', comes from the Swedish name, ''Noux'', an old name which has had many forms, such as ''Noox'' (1540), ''Noosis'' (1541), ''Nooxby'' (1552) and ''Nowx'' (1556). The name has been thought to have been derived from the [[Sami languages|Sámi]] word ''njukča'', meaning [[swan]].<ref> [http://www.espoo.fi/default.asp?path=1;28;11866;17468;17633;17653;17715;17716 Etymologies of the names of the districts of Espoo (in Finnish)] </ref> == References == <references/> == See also == * [[Vanha-Nuuksio]] * [[Districts of Espoo]] [[Image:Nuuksioruska.png|thumb|left|200px|Lake Mustalampi]] {{espoo}} {{coord|60|15|N|24|36|E|region:FI_type:city_source:GNS-enwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts of Espoo]] {{SouthernFinland-geo-stub}}
